hanzi-su-wiki:
難

Значения

Трудность, бедствие; нападки; критика; трудный; трудный

Мнемоника

Слева — жёлтый 黄 и земля 土 в значении «место с сухой и выжженной травой», где живут одни только птицы 隹 и царит бедность.

Варианты

難, 难

難以 [ nán yǐ ]: hard to (predict, imagine etc)
難道 [ nán dào ]: don't tell me ...; could it be that...?
難題 [ nán tí ]: difficult problem
難得 [ nán dé ]: seldom; rare; hard to come by
難民 [ nàn mín ]: refugee

heisig_chinese_memo: It is difficult for a scarecrow to scare a turkey or else they would've been called scareturkeys.

koohiiStory1: Learning Kanji is difficult for Turkeys.

jp_example_words:
有難う(ありがとう): Thank you
難い(かたい): difficult, hard
遭難(そうなん): disaster, shipwreck, accident
難(なん): difficulty, hardships, defect
避難(ひなん): taking refuge, finding shelter
非難(ひなん): blame, attack, criticism
無難(ぶなん): safety, security
有難い(ありがたい): grateful, thankful, welcome, appreciated
困難(こんなん): difficulty, distress

jp_readingExamples: 難い (かた.い), 難しい (むずか.しい)
WaniKani_Meaning_Mnemonic: A Chinese turkey is difficult to find because they are so rare. Chinese turkeys are the rarest variety of turkey, so naturally, finding one is exceedingly difficult.
WaniKani_Meaning_Info: Try and picture a Chinese turkey in your brain. Now imagine yourself trying to catch it, but you just can’t. It’s too difficult. The Chinese turkey is too elusive.
WaniKani_Reading_Mnemonic: Do you know the actual reason Chinese turkeys are so difficult to find? Do you know how many Chinese turkeys there are in the world? None (なん). They don’t exist. How many Chinese turkeys are there? None.
WaniKani_Reading_Info: So this is why you had such a difficult time finding and catching one – there were none to be caught. Imagine the sadness you felt when you realized that there were no Chinese turkeys to catch and that none exist in this world.
Ru_Radicals: 亠 (крышка), 口 (рот), 大 (большой), 艾 (мокса), 隹 (старая птица)
Ru_trainchinese:

nán: (графема) плохой, неприятный
nàn: (графема) несчастье, бедствие, катастрофа; упрекать, обличать
Kanshudo_mnemonic: the husband with the grass mouth (𦰩) finds the little bird (隹) difficult
chinese_mnemonics_deck__story: The turkey is difficult to find because his right hand man is always keeps him safe and out of sight.
humanum_full_description_en:
" Difficult " is originally the name of the bird, and "隹" is the meaning symbol, which means bird. It is a sound symbol, and later on the guise of being difficult and easy.

The word " difficult " in " Shuawen " or "隹", "堇" sound, see "堇". Before the late Spring and Autumn Period, the " difficulties " in the bronze inscriptions were all from the " huang " from the "隹", and the Zhongshan King Ding from the "隹" in the late Warring States period. sound.

"Said Wen": "𪅀, the birds. From the sound of the birds. 𩀤, 𪅀 or from the 隹. 𩁚, ancient prose𪅀. 𩁤, ancient prose𪅀.𩀙, ancient prose𪅀." Duan Yucai's note: "Today is a difficult and easy word. The original meaning is hidden."

The inscriptions in inscriptions mean difficulty and not easy, Zhongshan Wangding: "This is easy to say but difficult to do" and "It is difficult to get close to neighbors." Also "difficult to grow old" is an idiom in the bronze inscription, which means longevity. Pan Jiliang's father pot: "It's hard to grow old for thousands of years." "poetry. "Pan Shui": "After drinking wine, Yongxi is hard to grow old." Xu Zhongshu quoted "Zhuangzi. The Great Master: "You are old but you look as if you are a child". "Difficult to get old" means being old and not declining in appearance, as if young.
humanum_short_description_en: " Difficult " was originally the name of a bird, but later under the guise of difficult and easy.
humanum_full_description:
「難」本為鳥名，「隹」為意符，表示鳥類，為聲符，後來假借為難易之難。

　　「難」字《說文》或體從「隹」，「堇」聲，參見「堇」。春秋晚期以前所見金文「難」皆從「黃」從「隹」，戰國晚期中山王鼎從「隹」，聲。

　　《說文》：「𪅀，鳥也。从鳥堇聲。𩀤，𪅀或从隹。𩁚，古文𪅀。𩁤，古文𪅀。𩀙，古文𪅀。」段玉裁注：「今為難易字，而本義隱矣。」

　　金文表示困難、不易之意，中山王鼎：「此易言而難行」、「鄰邦難親」。又「難老」是金文中的習語，表示長壽。殳季良父壺：「其萬年霝終難老」。《詩．泮水》：「既飲旨酒，永錫難老。」徐中舒引《莊子．大宗師》：「子之年長矣而色若孺子」解之，「難老」即是年長而外貌不衰，如若年少。
humanum_short_description: 「難」本為鳥名，後來假借為難易之難。

①不容易，做起來費事：難處。難度。難點。難關。難熬。難耐。難產。難堪。難題。難以。難於。困難。畏難。急人之難。
②不大可能辦到，使人感到困難：難免。難爲。難保。難怪。難倒(dǎo)。難道。難能可貴。
③不好：難聽。難看。
④易。

②仇怨：排難解紛。
③詰責，質問：發難。非難。責難。

Before the late Spring and Autumn Period, the " difficulties" in the bronze inscriptions were all from the " huang" from the " 隹", and the Zhongshan King Ding from the " 隹" in the late Warring States period. sound. "Said Wen": "𪅀, the birds. From the sound of the birds. 𩀤, 𪅀 or from the 隹. 𩁚, ancient prose𪅀. 𩁤, ancient prose𪅀.𩀙, ancient prose𪅀." Duan Yucai's note: "Today is a difficult and easy word. 難字的基本解释

難
nán

難
nàn

難
nuó
均见“难”。

難字的汉语字典释义

[①]［nán］
［《廣韻》那干切，平寒，泥。］
“难1”的繁体字。
(1)困难；不易。
(2)使困难；使感到困难。
(3)不能；不好。
(4)厌恶；忌恨。
(5)方言。现在。
[②]［nàn］
［《廣韻》奴案切，去翰，泥。］
“难2”的繁体字。
(1)危难；祸患。
(2)引申为罹难。
(3)变乱。
(4)仇敌。
(5)拒斥。
(6)责难；诘问。
(7)疑问，疑难。
(8)畏惧；担心。
(9)谨慎。
(10)通“戁”。恭敬。
[③]［nuó］
［《集韻》囊何切，平戈，泥。］
“难3”的繁体字。
(1)驱逐鬼疫。后作“儺”。
(2)茂盛貌。
(3)奈何。《左传·昭公十年》：“忠爲令德，其子弗能任，罪猶及之，難不慎也。”杨树达曰：“按顧氏炎武云：'言不可不慎。'非是。今定此字讀如《左傳》'棄甲則那'之'那'，奈何也。”见《词诠·卷二》。一说不可，不能。孔颖达疏：“言人居身難可不謹慎。”
(4)语气助词。

難字的康熙字典解释

【戌集中】【隹字部】　難； 康熙笔画：19； 页码：页1370第05
〔古文〕????????【廣韻】【韻會】那干切【集韻】那肝切，?音䕿。【說文】鳥也。本作?。　又【玉篇】不易之稱也。【書·臯陶謨】惟帝其難之。【咸有一德】其難其愼。　又珠名。【曹植·美人行】珊瑚閒木難。【註】《南越志》曰：木難，金翅鳥沫所成碧色珠也。　又姓。【正字通】南北朝難從党。見《姓苑》。　又【集韻】【韻會】囊何切【正韻】奴何切。?同儺。【集韻】難，卻除凶惡也。【周禮·春官·占夢】遂令始難歐疫。【夏官·方相氏】率百隸而時難，以索室驅疫。【禮·月令】季春，命國難。【又】季冬命有司大難。　又【詩·小雅】其葉有難。【傳】難然盛貌。【釋文】乃多反。　又【集韻】乃可切，音娜。同橠。詳木部橠字註。　又【廣韻】奴案切【集韻】【韻會】【正韻】乃旦切，?音㬮。【廣韻】患也。【易·否卦】君子以儉德辟難，不可榮以祿。【禮·曲禮】臨難毋苟免。【周禮·地官·調人】掌司萬民之難，而諧和之。【註】難，相與爲仇讎。　又詰辨也。【唐史·韋處厚傳】張平叔議糶鹽，韋處厚發十難以

(2) By extension, it is the death.
(3) Disorder.
(4) The enemy.
(5) Rejection.
(6) Blaming; interrogation.
(7) Questions, difficulties.

["Jiyun" pouch is cut, pingge, mud. ]

(2) Lush appearance.
(3) Nai He. "Ten Years of Zuo Zhuan · Zhaogong": "Loyalty is the morality, and his son can do the job. The crime is beyond the reach, and it is hard to be careless." Old glyph

Name meaning
Nothing.
nán, nàn
вм. 难
Radicals: 隹  (turkey, chinese)
Meaning Mnemonic
A Chinese turkey is difficult to find because they are so rare. Chinese turkeys are the rarest variety of turkey, so naturally, finding one is exceedingly difficult.
Try and picture a Chinese turkey in your brain. Now imagine yourself trying to catch it, but you just can’t. It’s too difficult. The Chinese turkey is too elusive.
Reading Mnemonic
Do you know the actual reason Chinese turkeys are so difficult to find? Do you know how many Chinese turkeys there are in the world? None (なん). They don’t exist. How many Chinese turkeys are there? None.
So this is why you had such a difficult time finding and catching one – there were none to be caught. Imagine the sadness you felt when you realized that there were no Chinese turkeys to catch and that none exist in this world.
